item.content:encoded:
Lucidia Metaverse is one of the top candidates for the best crypto of 2023. Its platform puts a lot of focus on security and managing digital identities. By using a Self-Sovereign Data Store (SSDS) SDK, Lucidia makes sure that its users’ credentials can be stored and accessed safely.

 

Some of the most important parts of Lucidia Metaverse’s security system are:

 

Account Creation and Encrypting Data: The SSDS SDK is in charge of creating accounts, encrypting data, and managing Vault access. Key Stretching algorithms like Scrypt or PBKDF2 are used to encrypt the username and password that users use to get into the Vault.

Key Rotation: The SDK makes it easy to change keys to keep security going.

Decentralized OAuth 2.0 Single Sign-On (SSO): The CentraPass decentralized OAuth 2.0 SSO flow is managed by the SDK, giving users a smooth and safe experience.

Verifiable Credentials: Verifiable credentials are stored in the SSDS and signed by trusted parties. Issuers can make them and give them to users to own or store.

Lucidia DID SDK: This SDK gives you a strong and safe way to manage digital identities and assets in the metaverse. It has tools for making, changing, and resolving DIDs (unique, persistent, and verifiable digital identities).

Globally Distributed Key-Value Database: The DID SDK comes with a globally distributed key-value database that stores important information about identities and assets in the metaverse. It acts as a verifiable data registry.

Schema for Digital Identities and Assets: The schema is made to hold important information for digital content applications like the Unreal Engine or Unity engine. It also has service links for resolving digital assets.

By putting in place a complete system for managing digital identities and assets, Lucidia Metaverse ensures that its users’ security is unique, interoperable, persistent, and can’t be changed.

item.content:encoded:
A Self-Sovereign Data Store (SSDS) SDK is used by Lucidia Metaverse to manage the storage and access of verifiable credentials. This makes sure that user data and digital assets are handled in a safe and reliable way.

Management of Account Access

The SSDS SDK is part of the Lucidia platform and is in charge of creating accounts, encrypting data, and getting into the Vault. Users get into the Vault through a secure username and password system that is encrypted with Key Stretching algorithms like Scrypt or PBKDF2.

Changes to the keys and SSO flow

The SDK makes it easy to change keys and manages the CentraPass decentralized OAuth 2.0 single sign-on (SSO) flow, which gives users a smooth and safe experience.

Verifiable Credentials

Credentials that can be checked are stored in the SSDS and signed by parties that can be trusted. They can be given to users to store in the Vault, or they can be given back to the user to store on their own. There are different ways to make it easy for these credentials to be shared.

Lucidia DID SDK

The Lucidia DID SDK provides a strong and safe way to manage digital identities and assets in the metaverse. It has tools for making, changing, and resolving DIDs (unique, persistent, and verifiable digital identities).

Verifiable Data Registry

The SDK has a globally distributed key-value database that acts as a data registry and stores important information about identities and assets in the metaverse. This database is called a “key-value store.” Users can easily get and check these attributes by using the DID resolver component.

A Plan for digital identity and Assets

The schema for digital identities and assets in the Lucidia metaverse is made to hold important information for digital content applications like the Unreal Engine or Unity engine. The schema also has service links for resolving digital assets. These service links are hosted by the issuers, who are the DIDs’ controllers.

In conclusion, the Lucidia Metaverse uses a complete system for managing digital identities and assets. This system makes sure that digital identities and assets are unique, interoperable, persistent, and can’t be changed. By using the Self-Sovereign Data Store (SSDS) SDK and the Lucidia DID SDK, the platform gives users and their digital assets a safe place to be in the metaverse.
